input: Each State Party shall, not later than 30 days after this Convention enters into force for it, submit to the Technical Secretariat a declaration specifying: (a) the name and location of each facility that has produced chemical weapons since 1 January 1946; (b) whether such facility is currently operational; and (c) whether such facility has been converted for purposes not prohibited under this Convention. A State Party that has not produced chemical weapons shall submit a declaration stating that it has no such facilities to declare.

input: Developed country Parties shall provide new and additional financial resources to enable developing country Parties to meet the agreed full incremental costs of implementing measures that are covered by paragraph 1 of this Article. They shall also provide such financial resources, including for the transfer of technology, needed by the developing country Parties to meet the agreed full incremental costs of implementing measures that are covered by paragraph 1 of this Article and that are agreed between a developing country Party and the international entity or entities referred to in Article 11.

input: Subject to the provisions of paragraph 4 of this Article, a Party may not invoke the provisions of this Agreement as a basis for ISDS claims arising from measures the Party adopts or maintains with respect to tobacco control, provided that such measures are: (a) implemented in a non-discriminatory manner; (b) not applied as a disguised restriction on investment; and (c) adopted or maintained in good faith for the protection of public health.

input: No State Party shall expel, return ('refouler') or extradite a person to another State where there are substantial grounds for believing that he would be in danger of being subjected to torture. For the purpose of determining whether there are such grounds, the competent authorities shall take into account all relevant considerations including, where applicable, the existence in the State concerned of a consistent pattern of gross, flagrant or mass violations of human rights.

input: Providers of high-risk AI systems shall, before placing on the market or putting into service a high-risk AI system, ensure that: (a) such system has undergone the relevant conformity assessment procedure referred to in Article 43; (b) technical documentation has been drawn up in accordance with Article 11; and (c) the system bears the required conformity marking. Where the conformity assessment has been carried out by a third party, the provider shall also ensure that the system has been registered in the EU database referred to in Article 60.

input: Each State Party undertakes to adopt, in accordance with its constitutional processes, any legislative, administrative and other measures necessary to implement its obligations under this Treaty. Each State Party shall designate or establish a competent national authority or authorities to serve as the national focal point for liaison with other States Parties and the Secretariat. Each State Party that is a nuclear-weapon State undertakes not to transfer nuclear weapons or other nuclear explosive devices, or control over such weapons or explosive devices, directly or indirectly, to any recipient whatsoever.

input: Members shall accord to the service suppliers of any other Member, in respect of the supply of a service, treatment no less favourable than that provided for under the terms, limitations and conditions agreed and specified in its Schedule. In the sectors where such commitments are undertaken, each Member shall ensure that all measures of general application affecting trade in services are administered in a reasonable, objective and impartial manner. No measures shall be applied in a manner which would constitute a means of arbitrary or unjustifiable discrimination between countries where like conditions prevail.

input: States Parties recognize the right of the child to be protected from economic exploitation and from performing any work that is likely to be hazardous or to interfere with the child's education, or to be harmful to the child's health or physical, mental, spiritual, moral or social development. States Parties shall take legislative, administrative, social and educational measures to ensure the implementation of the present article. To this end, and having regard to the relevant provisions of other international instruments, States Parties shall in particular: (a) provide for a minimum age or minimum ages for admission to employment; (b) provide for appropriate regulation of hours and conditions of employment; (c) provide for appropriate penalties or other sanctions to ensure the effective enforcement of the present article.

input: Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this Article, each Party reserves the right to deny the benefits of this Chapter to: (a) investors of another Party if the investor is an enterprise of that other Party and persons of a non-Party own or control the enterprise and the denying Party does not maintain diplomatic relations with the non-Party or adopts or maintains measures with respect to the non-Party that prohibit transactions with the enterprise; (b) investors of another Party if the investor is an enterprise of that other Party and persons of the denying Party own or control the enterprise and the enterprise has no substantial business activities in the territory of any Party other than the denying Party.

input: AI systems used by public authorities or on their behalf for the purpose of determining access or assigning to natural persons to educational and vocational training institutions, for assessing students in those institutions and for assessing participants in tests commonly required for admission to such institutions, shall be considered high-risk. This does not include AI systems intended to be used for the purpose of supporting the administrative process for education if the systems do not directly affect the educational outcome or qualifications of the individuals.
